metadata.title: CVE-2017-9119 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
The i_zval_ptr_dtor function in Zend/zend_variables.h in PHP 7.1.5 allowsattackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption and applicationcrash) or possibly have unspecified other impact by triggering craftedoperations on array data structures.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9119` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.4 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.10
libphp7.4-embed - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.10
php7.4 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.10
php7.4-bcmath - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.10
php7.4-bz2 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.10

criterions.comment: php7.4 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.4.3-4ubuntu2.10').
